intro: Hedyotis acuminata f. iaoensis, commonly known as the Iao Mountain shieldflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Hainan Island in China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes numerous species of flowering plants found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves, which are typically covered in fine hairs. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often growing in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
